Events.text: The Lateran Council condemned the Council of Hieria and anathematized its iconoclastic rulings.
Events.html: The Lateran Council condemned the Council of Hieria and anathematized its iconoclastic rulings.

Events.text: Bari, the last Byzantine possession in southern Italy, is surrendered to Robert Guiscard.
Events.html: Bari, the last Byzantine possession in southern Italy, is surrendered to Robert Guiscard.

Events.text: Timur defeats Tokhtamysh of the Golden Horde at the Battle of the Terek River. The Golden Horde capital city, Sarai, is razed to the ground and Timur installs a puppet ruler on the throne.
Events.html: Timur defeats Tokhtamysh of the Golden Horde at the Battle of the Terek River. The Golden Horde capital city, Sarai, is razed to the ground and Timur installs a puppet ruler on the throne.

Events.text: Battle of Formigny: Toward the end of the Hundred Years' War, the French attack and nearly annihilate English forces, ending English domination in Northern France.
Events.html: Battle of Formigny: Toward the end of the Hundred Years' War, the French attack and nearly annihilate English forces, ending English domination in Northern France.

Events.text: Battle of Rain: Swedes under Gustavus Adolphus defeat the Holy Roman Empire during the Thirty Years' War.
Events.html: Battle of Rain: Swedes under Gustavus Adolphus defeat the Holy Roman Empire during the Thirty Years' War.

Events.text: Irish Confederate Wars: A Confederate Irish militia is routed in the Battle of Kilrush when it attempts to halt the progress of a Royalist Army.
Events.html: Irish Confederate Wars: A Confederate Irish militia is routed in the Battle of Kilrush when it attempts to halt the progress of a Royalist Army.

Events.text: The Pocotaligo Massacre triggers the start of the Yamasee War in colonial South Carolina.
Events.html: The Pocotaligo Massacre triggers the start of the Yamasee War in colonial South Carolina.

Events.text: Foundation of the Kingdom of Corsica
Events.html: Foundation of the Kingdom of Corsica

Events.text: Serse, an Italian opera by George Frideric Handel receives its premiere performance in London, England.
Events.html: Serse, an Italian opera by George Frideric Handel receives its premiere performance in London, England.

Events.text: Samuel Johnson's A Dictionary of the English Language is published in London.
Events.html: Samuel Johnson's A Dictionary of the English Language is published in London.

links.title: A Dictionary of the English Language

Events.text: Preliminary articles of peace ending the American Revolutionary War (or American War of Independence) are ratified.
Events.html: Preliminary articles of peace ending the American Revolutionary War (or American War of Independence) are ratified.

Events.text: Thomas Hopkins Gallaudet and Laurent Clerc founded the American School for the Deaf, the first American school for deaf students, in Hartford, Connecticut.
Events.html: Thomas Hopkins Gallaudet and Laurent Clerc founded the American School for the Deaf, the first American school for deaf students, in Hartford, Connecticut.

Events.text: President Abraham Lincoln calls for 75,000 Volunteers to quell the insurrection that soon became the American Civil War.
Events.html: President Abraham Lincoln calls for 75,000 Volunteers to quell the insurrection that soon became the American Civil War.

Events.text: President Abraham Lincoln dies after being shot the previous evening by actor John Wilkes Booth. Vice President Andrew Johnson becomes President upon Lincoln's death.
Events.html: President Abraham Lincoln dies after being shot the previous evening by actor John Wilkes Booth. Vice President Andrew Johnson becomes President upon Lincoln's death.

Events.text: The General Electric Company is formed.
Events.html: The General Electric Company is formed.

Events.text: Closing ceremony of the Games of the I Olympiad in Athens, Greece.
Events.html: Closing ceremony of the Games of the I Olympiad in Athens, Greece.

Events.text: Philippine–American War: Filipino guerrillas launch a surprise attack on U.S. infantry and begin a four-day siege of Catubig, Philippines.
Events.html: Philippine–American War: Filipino guerrillas launch a surprise attack on U.S. infantry and begin a four-day siege of Catubig, Philippines.

Events.text: Triangle Fraternity is founded at the University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign
Events.html: Triangle Fraternity is founded at the University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign

Events.text: The British passenger liner RMS Titanic sinks in the North Atlantic at 2:20 a.m., two hours and forty minutes after hitting an iceberg. Only 710 of 2,227 passengers and crew on board survive.
Events.html: The British passenger liner RMS Titanic sinks in the North Atlantic at 2:20 a.m., two hours and forty minutes after hitting an iceberg. Only 710 of 2,227 passengers and crew on board survive.

Events.text: Two security guards are murdered during a robbery in South Braintree, Massachusetts. Anarchists Sacco and Vanzetti would be convicted of and executed for the crime, amid much controversy.
Events.html: Two security guards are murdered during a robbery in South Braintree, Massachusetts. Anarchists Sacco and Vanzetti would be convicted of and executed for the crime, amid much controversy.

Events.text: U.S. Senator John B. Kendrick of Wyoming introduces a resolution calling for an investigation of a secret land deal, which leads to the discovery of the Teapot Dome scandal.
Events.html: U.S. Senator John B. Kendrick of Wyoming introduces a resolution calling for an investigation of a secret land deal, which leads to the discovery of the Teapot Dome scandal.

Events.text: Insulin becomes generally available for use by people with diabetes.
Events.html: Insulin becomes generally available for use by people with diabetes.

Events.text: Rand McNally publishes its first road atlas.
Events.html: Rand McNally publishes its first road atlas.

Events.text: First day of the Arab revolt in Mandatory Palestine.
Events.html: First day of the Arab revolt in Mandatory Palestine.

Events.text: In the Belfast Blitz, two-hundred bombers of the German Luftwaffe attack Belfast, killing around one thousand people.
Events.html: In the Belfast Blitz, two-hundred bombers of the German Luftwaffe attack Belfast, killing around one thousand people.

Events.text: The George Cross is awarded "to the island fortress of Malta: Its people and defenders" by King George VI.
Events.html: The George Cross is awarded "to the island fortress of Malta: Its people and defenders" by King George VI.

Events.text: Bergen-Belsen concentration camp is liberated.
Events.html: Bergen-Belsen concentration camp is liberated.

Events.text: Jackie Robinson debuts for the Brooklyn Dodgers, breaking baseball's color line.
Events.html: Jackie Robinson debuts for the Brooklyn Dodgers, breaking baseball's color line.

Events.text: McDonald's restaurant dates its founding to the opening of a franchised restaurant by Ray Kroc, in Des Plaines, Illinois
Events.html: McDonald's restaurant dates its founding to the opening of a franchised restaurant by Ray Kroc, in Des Plaines, Illinois

Events.text: At Shaw University in Raleigh, North Carolina, Ella Baker leads a conference that results in the creation of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee, one of the principal organizations of the Civil Rights Movement in the 1960s.
Events.html: At Shaw University in Raleigh, North Carolina, Ella Baker leads a conference that results in the creation of the Student Nonviolent Coordinating Committee, one of the principal organizations of the Civil Rights Movement in the 1960s.

Events.text: The EC-121 shootdown incident: North Korea shoots down a United States Navy aircraft over the Sea of Japan, killing all 31 on board.
Events.html: The EC-121 shootdown incident: North Korea shoots down a United States Navy aircraft over the Sea of Japan, killing all 31 on board.

Events.text: During the Cambodian Civil War, massacres of the Vietnamese minority results in 800 bodies flowing down the Mekong river into South Vietnam.
Events.html: During the Cambodian Civil War, massacres of the Vietnamese minority results in 800 bodies flowing down the Mekong river into South Vietnam.

Events.text: The United States launches Operation El Dorado Canyon, its bombing raids against Libyan targets in response to a bombing in West Germany that killed two U.S. servicemen.
Events.html: The United States launches Operation El Dorado Canyon, its bombing raids against Libyan targets in response to a bombing in West Germany that killed two U.S. servicemen.

links.title: History of Libya under Muammar Gaddafi

Events.text: Hillsborough disaster: A human crush occurs at Hillsborough Stadium, home of Sheffield Wednesday, in the FA Cup Semi-final, resulting in the deaths of 96 Liverpool fans.
Events.html: Hillsborough disaster: A human crush occurs at Hillsborough Stadium, home of Sheffield Wednesday, in the FA Cup Semi-final, resulting in the deaths of 96 Liverpool fans.

Events.text: Upon Hu Yaobang's death, the Tiananmen Square protests of 1989 begin in China.
Events.html: 1989 – Upon Hu Yaobang's death, the Tiananmen Square protests of 1989 begin in China.

Events.text: Two bombs explode near the finish line at the Boston Marathon in Boston, Massachusetts, killing three people and injuring 264 others.
Events.html: Two bombs explode near the finish line at the Boston Marathon in Boston, Massachusetts, killing three people and injuring 264 others.

Events.text: In the worst massacre of the South Sudanese Civil War, at least 200 civilians were gunned down after seeking refuge in houses of worship as well as hospitals.
Events.html: In the worst massacre of the South Sudanese Civil War, at least 200 civilians were gunned down after seeking refuge in houses of worship as well as hospitals.
